comments.body: This could just be implemented with the sound particles travelling farther and changing directions in certain situations
Good idea
Sometimes it's the little things that make the game good : )

I had an idea similar to yours regarding music villagers, but mine don't use blocks. My suggestion for this case is the creation of singing villagers.

The way to increase this idea is through musical choirs, being groups of up to 4 villagers who sing a symphony through sound and their typical phrases, the "humm". Each villager has a different rhythm that forms a unique music.

This addition would be fun to give more life to the villages, which would have a new form of entertainment, in addition to allowing new ways to compose music to the game.
they now have!
No, it does sound like Minecraft, let other artists make music for it, stop being biased and overly-nostalgic, it's annoying. Also, new music was already added in 1.16, and it WASN'T by C418.
the point of minecraft is more then the music author.
Bad take the new music is amazing

I do agree, I don't feel like they're disrespecting C418, but something feels off when i hear that music. But what I have also been feeling is when C418 starts playing at some point, it hits harder than before the new music, because I've been overloaded with it.

Its so damn godawful i literally cannot listen to it, it sounds like the dubstep equivalent of someone taking a dump, i literally get angey when i hear it, its so damn bad. It does not sound like minecraft at all and its just awful dubstep. C418 made better music.

I don‚Äôt hate the new music but I feel similar, it‚Äôs not Minecraft, it has a similar feel, and similar sound, but something pushes to far. It feels like it‚Äôs trying too hard to be C413 but you can tell it‚Äôs not. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a slap in the face to C413 or the game but I personally prefer to play with the music off now, something about the new songs just don‚Äôt sit right. I wish it was just me but my cousin feels the same and he just recently started playing. Every song that he likes ends up being one of the classics so obviously there‚Äôs something far different to it. If you like keep liking it though! My opinion don‚Äôt really matter lol
You do know that you can still get the old ambience music still, right? Just not as much because of the new music
Bro why didnt they just hire CF18 again like that would have been a way better decisiion and it would make the community happier + better music and not this trash that we have to listen to
Valid take. The new music is nowhere near the same. I‚Äôd like a menu option to keep the old ambience.
Agreed, I will say Lena Raine did a fantastic job with the nether soundtrack. Not a fan of the rest of her stuff though
I find it too emotional, not like the simplicity of C418's songs. It almost tries to be in the spotlight...

The only problem I can see with this is the majority of skins in the game aren't Steve, nor are they Alex. Possibly there could be an option in the settings to toggle which one you want to select when you take damage, so it can tie onto any skin regardless of gender... especially because there are a lot of skins that are non-binary or have no specific male or female gender role to really apply it to. This is where they'd select bone-cracking sound effects, or possibly add a neutral one where it isn't necessarily male or female.
This should be in the Parity section just to give you a heads up.
ye
It should muffle the music a bit when you hop in water in my opinion

yes please i need this. I really hate the cut when you go in water or leave the end/nether. It just stops. Please fix this, i think this is a bug more than an actual feature, but still, i want to have a softer change between soundtracks.

I made a post in reddit, if you want o check it out:

https://www.reddit.com/r/minecraftsuggestions/comments/fdvqby/better_transition_when_music_stops_for_example/

I had just come here to make this same suggestion. I would love to occasionally hear seagulls by the shore, relaxing wave sounds by deep oceans, birds song in forests, and market chatter in villages just for example. If these are not implemented as ambient nature sounds in the game itself, I would love to see them as music discs so the player can use them in builds per se.
Axolotl is already in the game. Swim in an ocean or a river to hear it.
What if you wanna listen to it in your house tho

I agree with u, I do want that sound too

for me its not the sounds themselves that annoy me but how they play... when a door is opened, it makes the closing sound and the opening sound. I wish that when you open a door it does the opening sound and not a random sound...
The java door sounds are bad for minecraft bedrock. Java and bedrock should have their own door sound effects.
Is now the same in the new update
But it kinda makes it hard to find foxes without them screaming. It makes finding them so much easier for my friend's huge berry bush farm.
Yes, please mojang. I keep thinking someone in real life is screaming and when i'm not expecting it, ugh chills.

you realy can't tame a fox

I absolutely LOVE this idea, sometimes when there‚Äôs no music the game feels a little empty. I also think it could be cool if trees would make a sound effect in response to the wind sound effect. So when the wind sound effect plays it would sound different if the player was surrounded by trees. Might help sell the ‚Äúin a forest‚Äù feeling.
This is very easy to implement, because the game already has a scary sound mechanic.

If there's going to be more wind the higher up you are then I think there should be even more wind in worse weather like blizzards or thunderstorms!

Perhaps wind would begin to mute as the player goes indoors?
I'm already sold; Wind sound effects forever!
Totally agree. It feels so empty. Rain gets a sound effect - why doesn't snow and wind? The game has very little immersion in this regard.
You already can in Java since they have multiple slide bars for individual type of sounds. Bedrock doesn't have that feature sadly.
In Java, you can already do this by turning the "Ambient/Environment" setting down to 0%, and in Bedrock, there really aren't that many cave sounds, to begin with.

Cave sounds aren't the only sounds affected by turning down the Ambient/Enviroment volume down, and they play randomly. It doesn't really seem like a practical strategy for dealing with them to me. Completely in favour of an option to disable them.
yes please add Atmos I really want to hear exactly where phantoms are
It would be really cool to have this in my 9.2.6 atmos theater
I have a little Living room Theater with Atmos to. I mean we have trough RTX on the Bedrock Edition incredible Grafics so why not incredible Sound
